unit_learning_outcomes.description: Identify, describe and evaluate many aspects of Japanese-speaking cultures and societies.
Apply relevant language conventions to create meaningful intercultural encounters.
Develop intermediate level skills in reading, writing, listening and speaking in the Japanese language.
Demonstrate a refined awareness of language and language use, in both Japanese and in English.
Identify, evaluate and deploy the grammatical structures of Japanese at intermediate level.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Students are expected to spend time on daily review of grammar and vocabulary, and Japanese practice. Students should be familiar with the content of a week before attending their second seminar, and feel comfortable with each week’s content before starting a new week.

enrolment_rules.description: Not to count for credit for students who completed HSC Japanese Extension, HSC Japanese in Context, HSC Japanese Literature

assessments.description: Weekly activities to ensure active engagement with the course materials. External students will do the tasks online.
A comprehensive test of reading and writing skills, covering all unit content. Student will complete their final test online.
An individual short speech and a group discussion. See iLearn for more details.
An individual short speech and a group discussion. The test will be conducted in class for Internal students and online for External students.
assessments.offerings: Session 2-Weekday-North Ryde, Session 2-exam_att-Exam centre within Australia

assessments.description: A comprehensive test of reading and writing skills, covering all unit content
assessments.offerings: Session 2-Weekday-North Ryde, Session 2-exam_att-Exam centre within Australia

assessments.description: A comprehensive test of listening, reading and writing skills, covering the unit content in the first half of the session.

Short quizzes to assess comprehension of the weekly contents. Students may consult grammar/kanji notes, seminar slides, workbooks and dictionaries, however, seeking help from other people is strictly prohibited.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 2, Attendance for exam only, Exam centre within Australia
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Special circumstances

academic_org.value: Department of Media, Communications, Creative Arts, Language and Literature

data.description: This unit is designed to further develop skills in all areas of Japanese language (reading, writing, listening and speaking) to a higher level of proficiency. Students further develop the ability to discuss a wider range of topics as well as substantially increase their knowledge of vocabulary and kanji. This unit continues to focus on further increasing students' skills in intercultural communication so that they will be able to communicate in a manner which is culturally as well as linguistically appropriate. Interactive tutorials and the use of online resources provide students with opportunities to use Japanese as much as possible.
data.title: I Japanese Studies 4
